meanings.definition: To make something seem better or more attractive than it really is.
meanings.sent1: She romanticizes her boring job by imagining it as an exciting adventure.
meanings.sent2: He always romanticizes his childhood, remembering only the fun times.
meanings.sent3: The movie romanticizes the life of a detective, making it look like a glamorous profession.
meanings.sent4: Her diary entry romanticizes the rainy day, turning it into a poetic experience.
meanings.sent5: The artist romanticizes the ordinary street scene, transforming it into a masterpiece.

meanings.definition: To view or interpret something in a way that emphasizes its positive aspects.
meanings.sent1: He romanticizes every situation, seeing only the good in people.
meanings.sent2: She romanticizes nature, finding beauty in every flower and tree.
meanings.sent3: The child romanticizes bedtime, thinking of it as a magical time to dream.
meanings.sent4: His speech romanticizes the idea of teamwork, inspiring everyone to work together.
meanings.sent5: The author romanticizes the concept of love, portraying it as a powerful force.
